paper_abstract: We investigate the notion of K-triviality for closed sets and continuous functions in 2(N). For every K-trivial degreee d, there exists a closed set of degree d and a continuous function of degree d. Every K-trivial closed set contains a K-trivial real. There exists a K-trivial Pi(0)(1) class with no computable elements. A closed set is K-trivial if and only if it is the set of zeroes of some K-trivial continuous function. We give a density result for the Medvedev degrees of K-trivial Pi(0)(1) sets. If W <= T A', then W can compute a path through every A'-decidable random closed set if and only if W = TA'
paper_title: K-Triviality of Closed Sets and Continuous Functions
